ch.aplu.android
Class GGMessageBox

java.lang.Object
  ch.aplu.android.GGMessageBox

public class GGMessageBox
extends java.lang.Object

Class to display a modal information dialog with 1, 2 or 3 buttons. It provides the easiest way to quickly display some information for the user in a modal message box and get a response which button is hit.

Nested Class Summary
static class GGMessageBox.ButtonHit
          Enum to define the button hit reponses.
static class GGMessageBox.ButtonLayout
          Enum to define the layout of the buttons.

Method Detail

show

public static GGMessageBox.ButtonHit show(java.lang.String title,
                                          java.lang.String message,
                                          GGMessageBox.ButtonLayout ButtonLayout)
Shows the modal dialog and blocks the current thread until the user hits one of the buttons. The screen orientation is fixed to what is was before, even when the screen is rotated while the dialog is shown.

Parameters:
title - the title in the header of the message box
message - the message shown (may be multiline, lines separated by \n)
ButtonLayout - one of the enumerations of ButtonLayout to define the arrangement of the buttons
Returns:
one of the enumerations of ButtonHit that reports which button was hit
